 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַחְמְתָא‎</span> (originally <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תָן‎</span>- or <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תָנָא‎</span>- [[BDB#Nö|Nö]] in Streck<sup>ZA 15, 368</sup>) **proper name, of a location** ==Ecbatana==, [[Ezra.6.2|Ezra 6:2]] capital of Media, captured by Cyrus ( B.C. 550), and then summer residence of Persian kings; modern <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***„amadân***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Spieg|Spieg]]<sup>244</sup> Margoliouth<sup>Hast. DB ACHMETHA,</sup> especially Brugsch<sup>Reise n. Persien (1862), i. 360-392</sup> (Old Median <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Agmatana***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Calwer Bib. Lex</sup>.; Old Persian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Hangamata§na***</u></abbr> (=***place of assembling***) [[BDB#Spieg|Spieg]]<sup>l.c.</sup>, Babylonian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Agam(a)tanu***</u></abbr> Beh<sup>60</sup>, [[BDB#Bez|Bez]]<sup>p. 26, etc</sup>.; <span class="bdbLangGreek">Ἀγβάτανα</span> [[BDB#Herod|Herod]]<sup>i. 98</sup>; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Ἐκβατανα</span> 2 Mace [[Ezra.9.3|Ezra 9:3]] +; [[BDB#Mey|Mey]]<sup>Geschichte. d. Alt. i. § 485</sup> Streck<sup>l.c. 367 f</sup>.
